FuncDef:
The dhcpv6-server keep-option command enables the BRAS to transparently transmit a specified option in response packets from DHCPv6 servers to clients in DHCPv6 relay scenarios.
The undo dhcpv6-server keep-option command restores the default configuration.
By default, the BRAS discards options in response packets from DHCPv6 servers to clients in DHCPv6 relay scenarios.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the code of an option to be transparently transmitted by the BRAS to clients.
Currently, the value can only be 17.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In DHCPv6 relay scenarios, the BRAS discards options carried in response packets sent from DHCPv6 servers to clients. To allow clients to receive a specified option, run the dhcpv6-server keep-option command to enable the BRAS to transparently transmit the option in response packets from DHCPv6 servers to clients.
Configuration Impact
After the dhcpv6-server keep-option command is run, the BRAS transparently transmits only the specified option. Other options are discarded.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
